topics.title: Mining basics
topics.description: A 60-second mental model for what mining does in a blockchain.

hook.text: Mining isn't just "digging coins" ‚Äî it's how a blockchain agrees on history.

buildup.text: Lots of computers propose the next block, but only one gets accepted.

discovery.text: Proof-of-Work makes proposing a block expensive (computational puzzle).

twist.text: The cost is the security: rewriting history gets wildly expensive.

climax.text: Miners earn rewards, so they're incentivized to follow the rules.

punchline.text: Mining = security + ordering + incentives (not magic money printers).
